tool.name: pcdl_make_conc_vtk
tool.command:
#import re mkdir output_pc && #for $file in $path: #set $filename = re.sub('[^\w\-\.\s]', '_', str($file.element_identifier)) ln -s $file output_pc/$filename && #end for
pcdl_make_conc_vtk output_pc --verbose $verbose

param.name: path
param.label: path
param.help: path to the PhysiCell output data collection

param.name: verbose
param.label: verbose
param.help: setting verbose to True for more text output, while processing. default is False.

tool.help:
function generates rectilinear grid vtk files, one per mcds time step, contains distribution of substrates over microenvironment. you can post-process this files in other software like paraview (https://www.paraview.org/).
homepage: https://github.com/elmbeech/physicelldataloader
